titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wel-Met Camps Supervisory Manuals TAM.380
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-02-26T14:14-0500

change.item: Edited by Heather Mulliner to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two supervisory manuals from the Wel-Met Camps, Narrowsburg, NY Division. The manuals contain information about the camp program, responsibilities of counselors, and overall goals of the camp.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Wel-Met Camps, which had divisions in Narrowsburg, Barryville and Silver Lake in Sullivan County, was founded as the Metropolitan Jewish Centers Camp Association in May 1935, and the name may have stood for Welfare Metropolitan. The camp association merged with Goddard-Riverside Community Center, and the camps began to be phased out in the 1970's. Goddard-Riverside, after changing the format, stopped its Wel-Met camping altogether in 1997. A separate Camp Welmet is run in Putnam County by the Mosholu Montefiore Community Center in the Bronx.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2079. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Fay Itzkowitz sent a gift of the two Wel-Met Camp supervisory manuals to Tamimet Library. The accession number associated with this gift is 2006.067.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Wel-Met Camps Supervisory Manual; TAM 380; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
